password: mongodump --uri="mongodb://{{ item.user }}:{{ item.password }}@{{ item.host | default('localhost') }}:{{ item.port | default('27017') }}/{{ item.name }}" --gzip --archive={{ backup_root_dir | default('/var/backups') }}/databases/{{ item.name }}-{{ ansible_date_time.iso8601_basic_short }}.archive
PGPASSWORD={{ vault_postgresql_password }} psql -h localhost -U {{ vault_postgresql_user }} -d homelab -c "SELECT version();"
PGPASSWORD={{ vault_postgresql_password }} psql -h localhost -U {{ vault_postgresql_user }} -d homelab -c "SELECT 1;" &
PGPASSWORD={{ vault_postgresql_password }} psql -h localhost -U {{ vault_postgresql_user | default('homelab') }} -d homelab -c "SELECT pg_sleep(1);" &

vaultwarden_database_url: "{{ 'postgresql://' + vaultwarden_database_user + ':' + vaultwarden_postgres_password + '@' + vaultwarden_database_host + ':' + vaultwarden_database_port | string + '/' + vaultwarden_database_name if vaultwarden_database_type == 'postgresql' else 'data/db.sqlite3' }}"
localhost: pg_dump -U {{ item.user }} -h {{ item.host | default('localhost') }} -p {{ item.port | default('5432') }} {{ item.name }} | gzip > {{ backup_root_dir | default('/var/backups') }}/databases/{{ item.name }}-{{ ansible_date_time.iso8601_basic_short }}.sql.gz

mysqldump -u {{ item.user }} -p{{ item.password }} -h {{ item.host | default('localhost') }} -P {{ item.port | default('3306') }} {{ item.name }} | gzip > {{ backup_root_dir | default('/var/backups') }}/databases/{{ item.name }}-{{ ansible_date_time.iso8601_basic_short }}.sql.gz

mongodump --uri="mongodb://{{ item.user }}:{{ item.password }}@{{ item.host | default('localhost') }}:{{ item.port | default('27017') }}/{{ item.name }}" --gzip --archive={{ backup_root_dir | default('/var/backups') }}/databases/{{ item.name }}-{{ ansible_date_time.iso8601_basic_short }}.archive

redis-cli -h {{ item.host | default('localhost') }} -p {{ item.port | default('6379') }} -a {{ item.password }} SAVE && cp {{ item.rdb_path | default('/var/lib/redis/dump.rdb') }} {{ backup_root_dir | default('/var/backups') }}/databases/redis-{{ ansible_date_time.iso8601_basic_short }}.rdb

PGPASSWORD={{ vault_postgresql_password }} psql -h localhost -U {{ vault_postgresql_user | default('homelab') }} -d homelab -c "SELECT pg_sleep(1);" &
ansible.builtin.command: docker exec {{ kibana_container_name }} curl -s -k https://localhost:{{ kibana_web_port }}/api/status
ansible.builtin.command: docker exec {{ elasticsearch_container_name }} curl -s -k https://localhost:{{ elasticsearch_web_port }}/_cluster/health
if ! curl -s http://localhost:6060/metrics > /dev/null; then echo "CrowdSec metrics are not accessible"; exit 1; fi
3. API Health Check: curl -v http://localhost:{{ security_authentik.port }}/api/v3/core/applications/
- { host: "{{ influxdb_host | default('localhost') }}", port: "{{ influxdb_port | default(8086) }}" }
- { host: "{{ prometheus_host | default('localhost') }}", port: "{{ prometheus_port | default(9090) }}" }
- { host: "{{ loki_host | default('localhost') }}", port: "{{ loki_port | default(3100) }}" }
127.0.0.1: docker exec crowdsec cscli decisions list --ip 127.0.0.1
192.168: plex_server_ip: "{{ lookup('env', 'PLEX_SERVER_IP') | default('192.168.1.41') }}"           # IP address of your existing Plex server
fail_msg: "Invalid network range format. Expected format: 192.168.1.0/24"
token: - Telegram Notifications: {{ 'Enabled' if vault_telegram_bot_token | default('') != '' else 'Disabled' }}
